result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick A Leopold was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant shall comply with any other terms of probation now serving.

ADA Kurczewski appeared remotely.
Defendant appeared in custody, remotely. Atty. Zamzow also appeared remotely.
The defendant was advised of his right to be present in person with the Court and his counsel; defendant wishes to proceed today.
Counsel have reviewed the revocation summaries, no corrections.
Statements by counsel and defendant.
The Court sentences the defendant to 3 years in the Wisconsin Prison System.
Initial term of confinement:  18 months     
Period of extended supervision 18 months
The sentence is concurrent with the sentence in 17 CF 290, but consecutive to any other sentence being served.
There is no credit on this case.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse and Challenge programs.
Any outstanding financial court obligations shall be reduced to civil judgment. 
Atty. Zamzow to file appeal rights.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 12, 2020 at 09:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 12, 2020 at 03:30 pm.
